Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Life-Giving Form]{Life-Giving Form}

You gain resistance 5 to precision damage and weakness 5 to negative damage, and your unarmed Strikes deal an extra [[/r {1d4}[positive]]]{1d4 positive damage}.

You can touch a living creature with an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Interact]{Interact} action to restore [[/r {6d8}[healing]]]{6d8 Hit Points} to it, and when a creature touches you with an Interact action you can allow it to gain the same healing; either way, the creature becomes temporarily immune to life-giving form's healing for 1 minute. This is a positive healing effect. You can't heal yourself with life-giving form. A creature harmed by positive damage (such as an undead) that touches you or damages you with an unarmed attack or non-reach melee weapon instead takes [[/r {3d4}[positive]]]{3d4 positive damage}, and it doesn't become temporarily immune.

You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dismiss]{Dismiss} this spell.

Heightened (+1) Increase the Hit Points restored with an Interact action by [[/r 1d8]], the positive damage by 1, and the resistance and weakness by 1.
